column5: Has anyone been out to Beaver River in Thornbury since the enormous amount of rain we received??? With such a rise of water is it even fish-able right now??  Thanks for any input, Its a far drive for me just wanna make sure im not wasting my time.
Fishable right now?  No, not even close.
Any trib, will be done for atleast a week. Should be prime after my return from the deer hunt.
I wouldn't say all, but 99% of them...  Should be good once the water levels get back to normal.
I had a feeling it would be a bad time, the nottawasaga looks like it rose over a foot!!!does anyone know of a website out there that post updates about water levels in rivers?
I have looked,but never came across one.
On the news last night the beaver was raging!!,Can't see that being ready any time soon.
Any thoughts on wilmot this weekend?
bring a 15 foot rod for sure!  just my thoughts
The Notty is up at least 2 ft!
I've seen the wilmot dirty up real bad and quickly wouldn't be surprised if its blown, and yeah a 13'6" will work..
If there's less than 300 hundred cars jammed along the side of the road, it's probably not fishable...
I dunno about 2ft, but it's definitely up and looking a lot like a Tim Hortons dbl/dbl, lol!
